title: World Needs Moral Teachings Like in Zoroastrianism
content: In an official message to the 11th World Zoroastrian Congress, President Hassan Rouhani stressed that the world is in dire need of moral teachings as those in Zoroastrianism.  “Good Thoughts, Good Words and Good Deeds” is one the main teachings of Zoroastrianism that the world should pay heed to, Rouhani wrote, adding, “this shows that our deeds and attitudes are influenced by our thoughts,” Mehr News Agency reported.  Zoroastrian Congress is a cause of pride for Iranians since Iran was the birthplace of Zoroaster, the messenger of righteousness, and also the first land of Zoroastrians, the massage read.  “Zoroaster emphasizes that we must avoid duplicity and impurities, so that our lives would be filled with goodness,” he noted.  Hoping that such congresses could send the message of this divine religion across the world, Rouhani wished success and happiness for all Zoroastrians, especially those in India.  The 11th World Zoroastrian Congress opened on Friday and will continue until June 4 in Perth, Australia.
